channel.title: Posts on Ed On Code
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ed On Code

item.title: Applying Hyperledger in Healthcare
item.description: On December 2 and 3, there was the Blue Hack XP, a data science hackathon that brought together programmers, data scientists, designers, healthcare professionals, and other technology development professionals.

item.title: From Frustation to Code
item.description: Our civilization is ignited on technology, nowadays, and until the next worldwide catastrophe, we lay down our comfort on the bed of technology. Let’s talk about the endless needing of professionals to work with technology for the next years to come.

item.title: Concurrency vs Paralelism
item.description: In a universe where everything falls at the same time, and we don’t even estimate the number of events happening around us, everything is changing; sometimes, there is no flow or foresight.

item.title: Practicing Golang (Part 1)
item.description: So I decided to show in practice (according to my bars) how to build a simple service using HTTP and to send requests and a bit of concurrency (nothing too complicated).

item.title: Practicing Golang (Part 2)
item.description: The time has come to talk about one of the main features of the Go language.

item.title: Golang One Month Later (Part 2)
item.description: Let’s continue with the second part of the previous post Golang One Month Later, and talk about how it is to edit the Golang code

item.title: Golang One Month Later (Part 1)
item.description: Maybe it’s been more than a month that I’m studying Go; however this is not the case, the important thing is that I want to share a little of what happened during this period

item.title: 48 Hours - From Zero To Hero
item.description: Last weekend on the 22nd, 23rd, and 24th, I attended the Startup Weekend Education; here in Florian√≥polis, it was one of the most exceptional experiences I have ever had in my entrepreneurial career (which also has very new). Our first meeting was on Friday on the 22nd, and I knew no one and nothing of what it would be or how it should proceed, you know that weird feeling of lost in the crowd?
